| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | [EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 1239](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/0.8.3/src/monst.c#L1239) |

- *For the monster in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), see [Pegasus](/wiki/Pegasus "Pegasus").*

A **pegasus**, u, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous") and [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") [horse-like](/wiki/Unicorn_or_horse "Unicorn or horse") [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that is [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivorous "Herbivorous") and capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight"), has enhanced [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration"), has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), and can be seen via infravision.

A pegasus has two kick attacks and a bite attack, and possesses [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") and [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Pegasi are not randomly generated, and are not valid forms for [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph"). A pegasus can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a [greater pegasus](/wiki/Greater_pegasus "Greater pegasus"), and a pegasus or greater pegasus [egg](/wiki/Egg "Egg") can hatch into a pegasus.

A pegasus is always generated on the lowest floor of the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm") at level creation, where it inhabits a small 2x2 cell next to the central room of the castle with up to 3 pegasus eggs placed on its square.

The pegasus cannot be targeted for [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide").

## Strategy

For characters capable of [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding"), a pegasus is easily among the best steeds at 24 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") and a generally solid pet besides, growing up into a greater pegasus in almost no time at all. Its lower [magic saving throw](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") of 50 compared to the greater pegasus's 90 also makes it the preferable form for zapping with beneficial wands such as [speed monster](/wiki/Wand_of_speed_monster "Wand of speed monster"). As a herbivorous monster, however, it can be difficult to find intrinsic-granting corpses.

The pegasus in the Ice Queen's Realm is usually freed after a character defeats [Kathryn the Ice Queen](/wiki/Kathryn_the_Ice_Queen "Kathryn the Ice Queen"), but it is possible to liberate the pegasus without having to face her: reading a non-cursed [scroll of taming](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming") while confused and standing as close as possible to the walls of its cell can potentially tame it; if the pegasus does not resist the effect, a [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle") or blessed [eucalyptus leaf](/wiki/Eucalyptus_leaf "Eucalyptus leaf") can be [applied](/wiki/Applied "Applied") to warp it out of the room.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Pegasus](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pegasus "wikipedia:Pegasus")***

Pegasus (Greek *Πήγασος* "Pḗgasos", Latin *Pegasus* or *Pegasos*) is a winged horse in classical mythology, usually depicted as a winged white stallion. Depending on the telling, he and his brother Chrysaor were both born when Medusa was decapitated by [Perseus](/wiki/Perseus "Perseus"), or else sprang from her blood as it was spilled upon the earth. Long honored as a constellation, Pegasus is a subject of very rich iconography, especially through ancient Greek pottery as well as paintings and sculptures of the Renaissance.

According to early myths, Pegasus created fountains wherever his hooves touched the ground, with one of these springs being the Hippocrene ("horse spring") of Mount Helicon. Despite the association with Perseus, Pegasus figures much more in the most famous tale of the Greek hero Bellerophon: he captures Pegasus near another fountain with the help of Athena and Poseidon, and the winged horse allows Bellerophon to ride him in order to defeat the monster Chimera. Later, Bellerophon rode Pegasus towards Mount Olympus, prompting Zeus to send a gadfly to sting Pegasus and throw Bellerophon off to his demise - in almost all tellings, Pegasus himself would make it to Olympus, where he was used to carry Zeus's thunderbolts.

## Encyclopedia entry

The famous winged horse, whose origin is thus related. When  
        Perseus struck off the head of Medusa, with whom Poseidon had  
        had intercourse in the form of a horse or a bird, there sprang  
        forth from her Chrysaor and the horse Pegasus. The latter  
        obtained the name Pegasus because he was believed to have made  
        his appearance near the sources (pegai) of Oceanus.  
                \[ Encyclopedia Mythica, ed. M.F. Lindemans ]

Pegasus (EvilHack)

From NetHackWiki

u pegasus
Difficulty 20

u pegasus
Difficulty 20
Attacks

Kick 2d6, Kick 2d6, Bite 4d4

Base level 18
Base experience 528
Speed 24
Base AC -4
Base MR 50
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1800
Nutritional value 350
Size Large
Resistances sleep, poison
Resistances conveyed None

A pegasus:

  • can fly.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • can lay eggs.
  • regenerates HP quickly.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • can be tamed by feeding.
  • wanders randomly.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference EvilHack 0.8.3 - monst.c, line 1239
For the monster in SLASH'EM, see Pegasus.

A pegasus, u, is a type of monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. It is a strong, oviparous and domestic horse-like animal that is herbivorous and capable of flight, has enhanced regeneration, has infravision, and can be seen via infravision.

A pegasus has two kick attacks and a bite attack, and possesses sleep resistance and poison resistance.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Origin
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

Pegasi are not randomly generated, and are not valid forms for polymorph. A pegasus can grow up into a greater pegasus, and a pegasus or greater pegasus egg can hatch into a pegasus.

A pegasus is always generated on the lowest floor of the Ice Queen's Realm at level creation, where it inhabits a small 2x2 cell next to the central room of the castle with up to 3 pegasus eggs placed on its square.

The pegasus cannot be targeted for genocide.

Strategy

For characters capable of riding, a pegasus is easily among the best steeds at 24 speed and a generally solid pet besides, growing up into a greater pegasus in almost no time at all. Its lower magic saving throw of 50 compared to the greater pegasus's 90 also makes it the preferable form for zapping with beneficial wands such as speed monster. As a herbivorous monster, however, it can be difficult to find intrinsic-granting corpses.

The pegasus in the Ice Queen's Realm is usually freed after a character defeats Kathryn the Ice Queen, but it is possible to liberate the pegasus without having to face her: reading a non-cursed scroll of taming while confused and standing as close as possible to the walls of its cell can potentially tame it; if the pegasus does not resist the effect, a magic whistle or blessed eucalyptus leaf can be applied to warp it out of the room.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Pegasus

Pegasus (Greek Πήγασος "Pḗgasos", Latin Pegasus or Pegasos) is a winged horse in classical mythology, usually depicted as a winged white stallion. Depending on the telling, he and his brother Chrysaor were both born when Medusa was decapitated by Perseus, or else sprang from her blood as it was spilled upon the earth. Long honored as a constellation, Pegasus is a subject of very rich iconography, especially through ancient Greek pottery as well as paintings and sculptures of the Renaissance.

According to early myths, Pegasus created fountains wherever his hooves touched the ground, with one of these springs being the Hippocrene ("horse spring") of Mount Helicon. Despite the association with Perseus, Pegasus figures much more in the most famous tale of the Greek hero Bellerophon: he captures Pegasus near another fountain with the help of Athena and Poseidon, and the winged horse allows Bellerophon to ride him in order to defeat the monster Chimera. Later, Bellerophon rode Pegasus towards Mount Olympus, prompting Zeus to send a gadfly to sting Pegasus and throw Bellerophon off to his demise - in almost all tellings, Pegasus himself would make it to Olympus, where he was used to carry Zeus's thunderbolts.

Encyclopedia entry

The famous winged horse, whose origin is thus related. When
        Perseus struck off the head of Medusa, with whom Poseidon had
        had intercourse in the form of a horse or a bird, there sprang
        forth from her Chrysaor and the horse Pegasus. The latter
        obtained the name Pegasus because he was believed to have made
        his appearance near the sources (pegai) of Oceanus.
                [ Encyclopedia Mythica, ed. M.F. Lindemans ]

{{For|the monster in [[SLASH'EM]]|Pegasus}}

A '''pegasus''', {{white|u}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a [[strong]], [[oviparous]] and [[domestic]] [[Unicorn or horse|horse-like]] [[animal]] that is [[herbivorous]] and capable of [[flight]], has enhanced [[regeneration]], has [[infravision]], and can be seen via infravision.

A pegasus has two kick attacks and a bite attack, and possesses [[sleep resistance]] and [[poison resistance]].

==Generation==
Pegasi are not randomly generated, and are not valid forms for [[polymorph]]. A pegasus can [[grow up]] into a [[greater pegasus]], and a pegasus or greater pegasus [[egg]] can hatch into a pegasus.

A pegasus is always generated on the lowest floor of the [[Ice Queen's Realm]] at level creation, where it inhabits a small 2x2 cell next to the central room of the castle with up to 3 pegasus eggs placed on its square.

The pegasus cannot be targeted for [[genocide]].

==Strategy==
For characters capable of [[riding]], a pegasus is easily among the best steeds at 24 [[speed]] and a generally solid pet besides, growing up into a greater pegasus in almost no time at all. Its lower [[Magic resistance (monster)|magic saving throw]] of 50 compared to the greater pegasus's 90 also makes it the preferable form for zapping with beneficial wands such as {{wand of|speed monster}}. As a herbivorous monster, however, it can be difficult to find intrinsic-granting corpses.

The pegasus in the Ice Queen's Realm is usually freed after a character defeats [[Kathryn the Ice Queen]], but it is possible to liberate the pegasus without having to face her: reading a non-cursed [[scroll of taming]] while confused and standing as close as possible to the walls of its cell can potentially tame it; if the pegasus does not resist the effect, a [[magic whistle]] or blessed [[eucalyptus leaf]] can be [[applied]] to warp it out of the room.

==Origin==
{{Wikipedia|Pegasus}}
Pegasus (Greek ''Πήγασος'' "Pḗgasos", Latin ''Pegasus'' or ''Pegasos'') is a winged horse in classical mythology, usually depicted as a winged white stallion. Depending on the telling, he and his brother Chrysaor were both born when Medusa was decapitated by [[Perseus]], or else sprang from her blood as it was spilled upon the earth. Long honored as a constellation, Pegasus is a subject of very rich iconography, especially through ancient Greek pottery as well as paintings and sculptures of the Renaissance.

According to early myths, Pegasus created fountains wherever his hooves touched the ground, with one of these springs being the Hippocrene ("horse spring") of Mount Helicon. Despite the association with Perseus, Pegasus figures much more in the most famous tale of the Greek hero Bellerophon: he captures Pegasus near another fountain with the help of Athena and Poseidon, and the winged horse allows Bellerophon to ride him in order to defeat the monster Chimera. Later, Bellerophon rode Pegasus towards Mount Olympus, prompting Zeus to send a gadfly to sting Pegasus and throw Bellerophon off to his demise - in almost all tellings, Pegasus himself would make it to Olympus, where he was used to carry Zeus's thunderbolts.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
        The famous winged horse, whose origin is thus related.  When
        Perseus struck off the head of Medusa, with whom Poseidon had
        had intercourse in the form of a horse or a bird, there sprang
        forth from her Chrysaor and the horse Pegasus.  The latter
        obtained the name Pegasus because he was believed to have made
        his appearance near the sources (pegai) of Oceanus.
                [ Encyclopedia Mythica, ed. M.F. Lindemans ]
}}
